page.title: 17Nidderdale Angling club
page.content: Nidderdale Angling club is responsible for stocking the river Nidd with brown trout, and some rainbow trout, four times a year. They also trim the trees along the river bank during the winter, to make the casting of fishing lines easier. The trout fishing season starts on April 1st and ends on September 30th. However, anglers can still fish for grayling after that date. The river has trout, grayling, minnows and eels in its waters. Fly fishing and bait fishing are allowed. From July to September, minnows are allowed as bait, as they are very affective. The fee for local adults is Â£16 and for juniors it is Â£7. For adults who live outside the dale, it costs Â£29 and Â£14 for the juniors. At least 2500 fish are caught each year. The heaviest fish caught in recent years weighed 3lb 14oz.
